attributes.action: Make Rochford Council put more disabled spaces into Rayleigh leisure center
attributes.additional_details:
The gym manager has previously asked rochford council to add more Spaces but have gotten no answer to it. 
This is meaning a 26 year old who lives in Hockley must go to Brentwood for a wheelchair friendly gym with free weights. 
I need the space of a double hatch space to get into my wheelchair and get bags out the car of equipment to take inside. Without a double hatch space I can’t. 
Otherwise make wheelchair only spaces that are patrolled. A wheelchair user has no option but to go home.
attributes.background: I am a wheelchair user and currently having to go to Brentwood gym as the local gyms are not wheelchair friendly. One of the gyms I could use,only have two disabled parking spaces and they are in use most of the time. Fusion in Rayleigh

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://rochford.cmis.uk.com/rochford/Members.aspx

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here: 

https://rochford.cmis.uk.com/rochford/EPetitions.aspx

You'll need to give your full name to start a petition.
